001package io.jstach.ezkv.kvs;
002
003import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
004import java.net.URI;
005import java.nio.charset.StandardCharsets;
006import java.nio.file.NoSuchFileException;
007import java.util.ArrayList;
008import java.util.Base64;
009import java.util.EnumSet;
010import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
011import java.util.List;
012import java.util.Map;
013import java.util.Objects;
014import java.util.Set;
015
016import org.jspecify.annotations.Nullable;
017
018import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter.Filter;
019import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter.FilterContext;
020import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.Variables.Parameters;
021
022/**
023 * Represents a resource that contains key-value pairs to be loaded and processed. A
024 * {@code KeyValuesResource} includes a URI, optional parameters, and metadata flags that
025 * determine its behavior during loading.
026 *
027 * <h2>Resource URIs</h2>
028 * <p>
029 * Out of the box, Ezkv supports the following URI schemas:
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * <ul>
033 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_CLASSPATH} - classpath
034 * resource</li>
035 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_CLASSPATHS} - for merging
036 * mulitple resources with the same name on the classpath (use with caution).</li>
037 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_FILE} - file resource</li>
038 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_SYSTEM} - System
039 * properties</li>
040 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_ENV} - Environment
041 * variables</li>
042 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_CMD} - Command line argument
043 * pairs separated by <code>=</code></li>
044 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_STDIN} - Allows Unix piping of
045 * key values, often useful for passwords</li>
046 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_PROFILE} - Will load multiple
047 * resources based on a CSV of profiles where the profile name replaces part of the
048 * URI</li>
049 * <li>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#SCHEMA_PROVIDER} - Will load reference
050 * key values provided from other modules/layers and is way for other modules/layers to
051 * share default configuration. See {@link KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesProvider}.
052 * </li>
053 * </ul>
054 *
055 * <h2>Resource Keys</h2>
056 * <p>
057 * Resources can have special keys associated with them. The most important key is the
058 * load key ({@link #KEY_LOAD}), which assigns a name to the resource. The resource name
059 * is the text after the {@value #DEFAULT_KEY_PREFIX} + {@value #KEY_LOAD} +
060 * {@value #DEFAULT_KEY_SEP} which becomes the resource name and the value of the key
061 * should be a URI. The resource name must match the regex: {@value #RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX}.
062 * For example <code>_load_myresource=URI</code> would have the {@linkplain #name() name}
063 * "<code>myresource</code>".
064 * </p>
065 * <p>
066 * All other keys can be specified in two ways:
067 * </p>
068 * <ol>
069 * <li><strong>In-URI keys</strong>: As query parameters in the resource's URI (these keys
070 * will be removed before the resource is loaded).</li>
071 * <li><strong>In-Resource keys</strong>: As additional key-value pairs within the same
072 * resource, using the resource name as part of the key (they keys will be removed from
073 * the final result).</li>
074 * </ol>
075 *
076 * <em>The parameters are combined from both the "In-URI keys" and "In-Resource keys" but
077 * "In-Resource keys" take prededence on collision.</em> One advantage that "In-URI keys"
078 * have is that they do not need the resource name as that can be deduced and order is
079 * guaranteed which is important for filters.
080 *
081 * <table class="table">
082 * <caption><strong>Resource Keys using default syntax</strong></caption> <thead>
083 * <tr>
084 * <th>Resource Key(s)</th>
085 * <th>Resource Syntax</th>
086 * <th>URI Syntax</th>
087 * <th>Description</th>
088 * </tr>
089 * </thead> <tbody>
090 * <tr>
091 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_LOAD}</td>
092 * <td><code>_load_[resource]</code></td>
093 * <td><strong>N/A</strong></td>
094 * <td>Specifies a resource to load. The resource name is defined as the content following
095 * <code>_load_</code>. It should be alphanumeric with no spaces.</td>
096 * </tr>
097 * <tr>
098 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_FLAGS} or
099 * {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_FLAG}</td>
100 * <td><code>_flags_[resource]</code></td>
101 * <td><code>_flags</code></td>
102 * <td>Defines flags associated with a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with the
103 * actual resource name.</td>
104 * </tr>
105 * <tr>
106 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_MEDIA_TYPE} or
107 * {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_MIME}</td>
108 * <td><code>_mediaType_[resource]</code></td>
109 * <td><code>_mediaType</code></td>
110 * <td>Specifies the media type of a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with the
111 * actual resource name.</td>
112 * </tr>
113 * <tr>
114 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_PARAM} or
115 * {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_PARM}</td>
116 * <td><code>_param_[resource]_[name]</code></td>
117 * <td><code>_param_[name]</code></td>
118 * <td>Defines parameters associated with a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with
119 * the actual resource name, and <code>[name]</code> with the parameter name, which should
120 * be alphanumeric with no spaces.</td>
121 * </tr>
122 * <tr>
123 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_FILTER} or
124 * {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#KEY_FILT}</td>
125 * <td><code>_filter_[resource]_[filter]</code></td>
126 * <td><code>_filter_[filter]</code></td>
127 * <td>Specifies filters to apply to a resource. Replace <code>[resource]</code> with the
128 * actual resource name, and <code>[filter]</code> with the filter identifier, both of
129 * which should be alphanumeric with no spaces.</td>
130 * </tr>
131 * </tbody>
132 * </table>
133 * <h3>Resource Flags</h3> As mentioned above flags are set with the {@value #KEY_FLAGS}
134 * key.
135 *
136 * <table class="table">
137 * <caption><strong>Resource loading flags</strong></caption> <thead>
138 * <tr>
139 * <th>Flag Value</th>
140 * <th>Description</th>
141 * </tr>
142 * </thead> <tbody>
143 * <tr>
144 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_REQUIRE}</td>
145 * <td>Indicates that the resource is optional and no error should occur if it is not
146 * found. Synonym: {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_OPTIONAL}</td>
147 * </tr>
148 * <tr>
149 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_SENSITIVE}</td>
150 * <td>Marks the resource as containing sensitive key-value pairs, which should not be
151 * displayed or included in output such as <code>toString</code>.</td>
152 * </tr>
153 * <tr>
154 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_ADD}</td>
155 * <td>Indicates that the key-value pairs from the resource should only be added to
156 * variables and not to the final resolved key-value set.</td>
157 * </tr>
158 * <tr>
159 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_INTERPOLATE}</td>
160 * <td>Disables interpolation entirely for key-value pairs loaded from this resource.</td>
161 * </tr>
162 * </tbody>
163 * </table>
164 *
165 * <p>
166 * <em>Note: flags can be negated textual by appending <code>NO_</code> /
167 * <code>NOT_</code> or removing <code>NO_</code> (if present) and are case
168 * insensitive</em>
169 * </p>
170 *
171 * <h3>Resource Filters</h3> As mentioned previously filters are set with the
172 * {@value #KEY_FILTER} key.
173 * <p>
174 * Out of the box, Ezkv supports the following resource filters:
175 * </p>
176 * <table class="table">
177 * <caption><strong>Resource Filters</strong></caption> <thead>
178 * <tr>
179 * <th>Filter</th>
180 * <th>Description</th>
181 * </tr>
182 * </thead> <tbody>
183 * <tr>
184 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FILTER_GREP}</td>
185 * <td>Grep filter, similar to Unix grep, allows picking keys based on matching
186 * regex.</td>
187 * </tr>
188 * <tr>
189 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FILTER_SED}</td>
190 * <td>Sed filter, similar to Unix sed, can rename or delete key-value keys using
191 * substitution (<code>s</code>) or delete (<code>d</code>) commands.</td>
192 * </tr>
193 * <tr>
194 * <td>{@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FILTER_JOIN}</td>
195 * <td>Join filter can join duplicate keys' values with the separator being the expression
196 * akin to <code>String.join(expression)</code>.</td>
197 * </tr>
198 * </tbody>
199 * </table>
200 *
201 * <h4>Filter Target</h4> The {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FILTER_GREP}
202 * and {@value io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesResource#FILTER_SED} filters by default target
203 * the keys for search and manipulation. These filter can target the value by suffixing
204 * with {@value #FILTER_TARGET_VALUE} or {@link #FILTER_TARGET_VAL}.
205 *
206 * <h3>Example</h3>
207 *
208 * Example usage for building a {@code KeyValuesResource}:
209 * {@snippet :
210 * var resource = KeyValuesResource.builder("classpath:/config.properties")
211 *      .name("config")
212 *      .flags("optional,interpolate")
213 *      .parameter("key1", "value1")
214 *      .sensitive(true)
215 *      .build();
216 * }
217 *
218 * @see KeyValuesServiceProvider
219 * @see KeyValuesLoader.Builder#add(KeyValuesResource)
220 * @see #builder(URI)
221 */
222public sealed interface KeyValuesResource extends NamedKeyValuesSource, KeyValueReference
223                permits InternalKeyValuesResource {
224
225        /**
226         * Resource names must match {@value #RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX} regular expression which is
227         * effectively only alphanumeric and no spaces.
228         */
229        public static final String RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX = "[a-zA-Z0-9]+";
230
231        /**
232         * Indicates that the resource is optional and no error should occur if it is not
233         * found. {@linkplain KeyValuesLoader Loaders} can indicate not found by throwing
234         * either {@link FileNotFoundException} or {@link NoSuchFileException}. If the
235         * resource is missing during a full load it will be logged with
236         * {@link KeyValuesEnvironment.Logger#missing(KeyValuesResource, Exception)}. Note
237         * that a resource may just not have any key values but is still found. By default
238         * resources are normally required to exist.
239         * @see #FLAG_NO_EMPTY
240         */
241        public static final String FLAG_NO_REQUIRE = "NO_REQUIRE";
242
243        /**
244         * A synonym for {@link #FLAG_NO_REQUIRE}.
245         */
246        public static final String FLAG_OPTIONAL = "OPTIONAL";
247
248        /**
249         * A synonym for {@link #FLAG_NO_REQUIRE}.
250         */
251        public static final String FLAG_NOT_REQUIRED = "NOT_REQUIRED";
252
253        /**
254         * Indicates that the resource should not be empty. Typically used to enforce that the
255         * resource contains at least one key-value pair. This is different than
256         * {@link #FLAG_NO_REQUIRE} which is if the resource does not exist at all. By default
257         * empty resources are normally allowed.
258         */
259        public static final String FLAG_NO_EMPTY = "NO_EMPTY";
260
261        /**
262         * Specifies that the resource is locked and its properties should not be overridden.
263         * This is distinct from {@link #FLAG_NO_REPLACE}, which has different semantics.
264         */
265        public static final String FLAG_LOCK = "LOCK";
266
267        /**
268         * Ensures that the resource can only add new key-value pairs and cannot replace
269         * existing ones.
270         */
271        public static final String FLAG_NO_REPLACE = "NO_REPLACE";
272
273        /**
274         * Indicates that the key-value pairs from the resource should only be added to
275         * variables and not to the final resolved key-value set.
276         */
277        public static final String FLAG_NO_ADD = "NO_ADD";
278
279        /**
280         * Prevents the resource from invoking <code>_load</code> calls to load additional
281         * child resources.
282         */
283        public static final String FLAG_NO_LOAD_CHILDREN = "NO_LOAD_CHILDREN";
284
285        /**
286         * Disables interpolation entirely for key-value pairs loaded from this resource.
287         */
288        public static final String FLAG_NO_INTERPOLATE = "NO_INTERPOLATE";
289
290        /**
291         * Marks the resource as containing sensitive key-value pairs, which should not be
292         * displayed or included in output such as `toString`.
293         */
294        public static final String FLAG_SENSITIVE = "SENSITIVE";
295
296        /**
297         * Hints to filters that they should retain and not alter resource keys.
298         * @see FilterContext#keyValueIgnore()
299         */
300        public static final String FLAG_NO_FILTER_RESOURCE_KEYS = "NO_FILTER_RESOURCE_KEYS";
301
302        /**
303         * Specifies that the resource should not be reloaded once it has been loaded.
304         */
305        public static final String FLAG_NO_RELOAD = "NO_RELOAD";
306
307        /**
308         * Indicates that the resource should pass its flags down to child resources
309         * regardless if the child resource has them set or not. To disable propagation on a
310         * child one could attach <code>NO_</code> in front of this flag.
311         */
312        public static final String FLAG_PROPAGATE = "PROPAGATE";
313
314        /**
315         * By default resource keys are prefixed with {@value #DEFAULT_KEY_PREFIX}. Note that
316         * other keys that are not resource keys may have this prefix and will not be filtered
317         * out.
318         */
319        public static final String DEFAULT_KEY_PREFIX = "_";
320
321        /**
322         * By default resource keys use this as separator to separate the resource key and
323         * resource name ({@link #KEY_LOAD}) as well as other key properties (filter id for
324         * {@link #KEY_FILTER} and parameter name for {@link #KEY_PARAM}).
325         */
326        public static final String DEFAULT_KEY_SEP = "_";
327
328        /**
329         * Key to specify a resource to load. The resource name is defined as the content
330         * following * <code>_load_</code>. It should be alphanumeric with no spaces.
331         * @see #RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX
332         */
333        public static final String KEY_LOAD = "load";
334
335        /**
336         * Defines flags associated with a resource.
337         * @see #KEY_FLAG
338         */
339        public static final String KEY_FLAGS = "flags";
340
341        /**
342         * Key for specifying the media type (or file extension) of a resource.
343         * {@link KeyValuesSystem#mediaFinder()} is then typically used for the lookup.
344         * @see #KEY_MIME
345         * @see KeyValuesMedia
346         */
347        public static final String KEY_MEDIA_TYPE = "mediaType";
348
349        /**
350         * Represents the key for specifying parameters associated with a resource and are
351         * usually suffixed with a separator and name of the parameter.
352         */
353        public static final String KEY_PARAM = "param";
354
355        /**
356         * Key for specifying filters to apply to the resource. The name after the last
357         * {@link #DEFAULT_KEY_SEP} is the filter id. The value of the key is the filter
358         * expression and its syntax and semantics vary by filter.
359         * @see KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesFilter
360         * @see #FILTER_SED
361         * @see #FILTER_GREP
362         */
363        public static final String KEY_FILTER = "filter";
364
365        /**
366         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_FLAGS}.
367         */
368        public static final String KEY_FLAG = "flag";
369
370        /**
371         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_MEDIA_TYPE}.
372         */
373        public static final String KEY_MIME = "mime";
374
375        /**
376         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_PARAM}.
377         */
378        public static final String KEY_PARM = "parm";
379
380        /**
381         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_PARAM}.
382         */
383        public static final String KEY_P = "p";
384
385        /**
386         * A synonym for {@link #KEY_FILTER}.
387         */
388        public static final String KEY_FILT = "filt";
389
390        // @formatter:off
391        /**
392         * Classpath resource is loaded using
393         * {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getResourceLoader()}.
394         *
395         * {@snippet lang=properties :
396         * _load_app=classpath:///app.properties
397         * }
398         */
399        // @formatter:on
400        public static final String SCHEMA_CLASSPATH = "classpath";
401
402        // @formatter:off
403        /**
404         * Classpaths (<strong> note the plural "s"</strong>) resource is loaded using
405         * {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getResourceLoader()}. This is analogous
406         * to Spring's <code>classpath*</code> resource support where all
407         * matching resources of the same name are loaded.
408         *
409         * {@snippet lang=properties :
410         * _load_app=classpaths:///app.properties
411         * }
412         * For security reasons this resource will not allow
413         * the found resources to load children.
414         */
415        // @formatter:on
416        public static final String SCHEMA_CLASSPATHS = "classpaths";
417
418        // @formatter:off
419        /**
420         * Will load provider(s) reference key values.
421         *
422         * {@snippet lang=properties :
423         * # load all providers registered
424         * _load_providers=provider:///
425         * # or load a specific provider from another module
426         * _load_provider_db=provider:///RepositoryLayerKeyValuesProvider
427         * }
428         *
429         * It is recommend that you do enable the service loader
430         * with {@link KeyValuesSystem.Builder#useServiceLoader()}
431         * and that you use this resource schema very early so
432         * that downstream key values can override it.
433         *
434         * @see KeyValuesServiceProvider.KeyValuesProvider
435         */
436        // @formatter:on
437        public static final String SCHEMA_PROVIDER = "provider";
438
439        // @formatter:off
440        /**
441         * File resource which is the default if no schema is given.
442         * {@snippet lang=properties :
443         * _load_somefile=file:///./app.properties
444         * _load_another=another.properties
445         * }
446         */
447        // @formatter:on
448        public static final String SCHEMA_FILE = "file";
449
450        /**
451         * System properties which come from
452         * {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getSystemProperties()}.
453         * <p>
454         * This schema can take a path that fetches a key value, where the value is used as
455         * the source of the key values. If no path is provided, all key values of the
456         * resource will be loaded.
457         *
458         */
459        public static final String SCHEMA_SYSTEM = "system";
460
461        /**
462         * Environment variables which come from {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getSystemEnv()}.
463         * <p>
464         * This schema can take a path that fetches a key value, where the value is used as
465         * the source of the key values. If no path is provided, all key values of the
466         * resource will be loaded.
467         */
468        public static final String SCHEMA_ENV = "env";
469
470        /**
471         * Command line argument pairs separated by <code>=</code>.
472         * <p>
473         * This schema can take a path that fetches a key value, where the value is used as
474         * the source of the key values. If no path is provided, all key values of the
475         * resource will be loaded.
476         */
477        public static final String SCHEMA_CMD = "cmd";
478
479        // @formatter:off
480        /**
481         * Allows Unix piping of key values, often useful for passwords.
482         * <p>
483         * <code>stdin:///</code> without a path assumes that the entire contents of stdin are
484         * in java.util.Properties key-value format. If this is not the case, it is advisable
485         * to specify _mediaType= explicitly with stdin.
486         * </p>
487         * <code>stdin:///</code> can also bind the input content, parsed as a UTF-8 string,
488         * to the key provided in the URI path.
489         * <p>
490         * Stdin is retrieved from {@link KeyValuesEnvironment#getStandardInput()}.
491         * Because checking stdin will block an application one must enable reading from it which is done
492         * by either:
493         * <ol>
494         * <li> Checking resource parameter of {@value #SCHEMA_STDIN_PARAM} is <code>true</code>.
495         * </li>
496         * <li>Setting {@value #SCHEMA_STDIN_MAIN_ARG_PARAM} to 
497         * {@linkplain KeyValuesEnvironment#getMainArgs() command line argument} to check if present.
498         * </li>
499         * <li>
500         * Relying on the default which will check <code>--</code> {@link KeyValuesResource#name()}
501         * command line argument is present.
502         * </li>
503         * </ol>
504         *
505         * {@snippet lang=properties :
506         * # will be enabled if --stdin is passed on the command line
507         * # since stdin in is the resource name.
508         * _load_stdin=stdin:///db.password?_flag=sensitive,optional
509         * # alternatively one can do:
510         * _load_stdin=stdin:///?_p_stdin=${some_other_variable}
511         * }
512         * @see #SCHEMA_STDIN_PARAM
513         * @see #SCHEMA_STDIN_MAIN_ARG_PARAM
514         * @see KeyValuesEnvironment#getMainArgs()
515         */
516        // @formatter:on
517        public static final String SCHEMA_STDIN = "stdin";
518
519        /**
520         * Resource parameter to enable stdin.
521         * @see #SCHEMA_STDIN
522         */
523        public static final String SCHEMA_STDIN_PARAM = "stdin";
524
525        /**
526         * Resource parameter to decide what command line argument should be present to allow
527         * reading from stdin.
528         * @see #SCHEMA_STDIN
529         */
530        public static final String SCHEMA_STDIN_MAIN_ARG_PARAM = "stdin_arg";
531
532        /**
533         * Will load multiple resources based on a CSV of profiles where the profile name
534         * replaces part of the URI.
535         */
536        public static final String SCHEMA_PROFILE = "profile.";
537
538        /**
539         * Grep filter just like unix grep allows pickings keys based on matching regex.
540         * @see #FILTER_GREP
541         */
542        public static final String FILTER_GREP = "grep";
543
544        /**
545         * Sed filter can rename or delete key values keys just like unix sed by substitution
546         * (<code>s</code>) command or delete command (<code>d</code>).
547         * @see #FILTER_GREP
548         */
549        public static final String FILTER_SED = "sed";
550
551        /**
552         * Join filter can join duplicate keys' values with the separator being the expression
553         * akin to <code>String.join(expression)</code>
554         */
555        public static final String FILTER_JOIN = "join";
556
557        /**
558         * This suffix on the end of the filter name will tell filters that support to target
559         * the key. Example: suff?_filter_grep_key=grep_key
560         */
561        public static final String FILTER_TARGET_KEY = "_key";
562
563        /**
564         * This suffix on the end of the filter name will tell filters that support to target
565         * the value. Example: suff?_filter_grep_value=grep_key
566         * @see #FILTER_TARGET_VAL
567         */
568        public static final String FILTER_TARGET_VALUE = "_value";
569
570        /**
571         * Synonym to {@link #FILTER_TARGET_VALUE}.
572         * @see #FILTER_TARGET_VALUE
573         */
574        public static final String FILTER_TARGET_VAL = "_val";
575
576        /**
577         * Returns the URI of the resource.
578         * @return the URI of the resource
579         */
580        @Override
581        public URI uri();
582
583        /**
584         * Returns the parameters associated with the resource which are specified with the
585         * resource key {@value #KEY_PARAM}. Parameters are away to configure custom plugins.
586         * @return the parameters as {@link Parameters}
587         * @see KeyValuesServiceProvider
588         */
589        public Parameters parameters();
590
591        /**
592         * Returns the name of the resource.
593         * @return the name of the resource
594         * @see #RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX
595         */
596        @Override
597        public String name();
598
599        /**
600         * Returns the {@link KeyValue} that references this resource, if any. This is
601         * normally the {@linkplain #KEY_LOAD load key} in the parent resource loaded key
602         * values.
603         * @return the reference {@code KeyValue}, or {@code null} if not applicable
604         */
605        @Override
606        public @Nullable KeyValue reference();
607
608        /**
609         * Returns the media type of the resource, if specified.
610         * @return the media type, or {@code null} if not specified
611         * @see KeyValuesMedia
612         * @see #KEY_MEDIA_TYPE
613         */
614        public @Nullable String mediaType();
615
616        /**
617         * Creates a builder based on the current state of this {@code KeyValuesResource}.
618         * @return a {@code Builder} initialized with the current state
619         */
620        public Builder toBuilder();
621
622        // TODO maybe we do not provide this.
623        /**
624         * Pretty toString of resource.
625         * @return pretty print resource.
626         */
627        default String description() {
628                return "uri='" + uri() + "' name='" + name() + "'" + ", reference="
629                                + KeyValueReference.toStringRef(this.reference());
630        }
631
632        /**
633         * Creates a builder for a {@code KeyValuesResource} from the given URI.
634         * @param uri the URI for the resource
635         * @return a new {@code Builder} instance
636         */
637        public static Builder builder(URI uri) {
638                return new Builder(uri, uriToName(uri));
639        }
640
641        /**
642         * Creates a builder for a {@code KeyValuesResource} from the given URI string.
643         * @param uri the URI string for the resource
644         * @return a new {@code Builder} instance
645         */
646        public static Builder builder(String uri) {
647                return builder(URI.create(uri));
648        }
649
650        private static String uriToName(URI uri) {
651                return Base64.getUrlEncoder()
652                        .withoutPadding()
653                        .encodeToString(uri.toASCIIString().getBytes(StandardCharsets.US_ASCII));
654        }
655
656        /**
657         * Builder class for creating instances of {@code KeyValuesResource}.
658         */
659        public final class Builder {
660
661                URI uri;
662
663                String name;
664
665                final Map<String, String> parameters;
666
667                final EnumSet<LoadFlag> flags;
668
669                final List<Filter> filters;
670
671                @Nullable
672                KeyValue reference;
673
674                @Nullable
675                String mediaType;
676
677                Builder(URI uri, String name) {
678                        this.uri = uri;
679                        this.name = DefaultKeyValuesResource.validateResourceName(name);
680                        this.parameters = new LinkedHashMap<>();
681                        this.flags = EnumSet.noneOf(LoadFlag.class);
682                        this.filters = new ArrayList<>();
683                }
684
685                Builder(URI uri, String name, Map<String, String> parameters, EnumSet<LoadFlag> flags,
686                                @Nullable KeyValue reference, @Nullable String mediaType, List<Filter> filters) {
687                        super();
688                        this.uri = uri;
689                        this.name = DefaultKeyValuesResource.validateResourceName(name);
690                        this.parameters = parameters;
691                        this.flags = flags;
692                        this.reference = reference;
693                        this.mediaType = mediaType;
694                        this.filters = filters;
695                }
696
697                /**
698                 * Sets the URI for the resource. The URI may contain resource keys and for a full
699                 * listing of that syntax see {@link KeyValuesResource}.
700                 * @param uri the URI to set
701                 * @return this builder instance
702                 * @see KeyValuesResource
703                 */
704                public Builder uri(URI uri) {
705                        this.uri = uri;
706                        return this;
707                }
708
709                /**
710                 * Sets the name for the resource. The name should match the regex
711                 * {@link KeyValuesResource#RESOURCE_NAME_REGEX}. The validation however is done
712                 * at build time and not on this call.
713                 * @param name the name to set
714                 * @return this builder instance
715                 */
716                public Builder name(String name) {
717                        this.name = Objects.requireNonNull(name);
718                        return this;
719                }
720
721                /**
722                 * Clears all parameters associated with the resource.
723                 * @return this builder instance
724                 */
725                public Builder clearParameters() {
726                        parameters.clear();
727                        return this;
728                }
729
730                /**
731                 * Adds a parameter key-value pair to the resource.
732                 * @param key the parameter key
733                 * @param value the parameter value
734                 * @return this builder instance
735                 */
736                public Builder parameter(String key, String value) {
737                        parameters.put(key, value);
738                        return this;
739                }
740
741                /**
742                 * Sets the media type for the resource.
743                 * @param mediaType the media type to set and can be the actual media type or the
744                 * file extension.
745                 * @return this builder instance
746                 * @see KeyValuesMedia
747                 */
748                public Builder mediaType(String mediaType) {
749                        this.mediaType = mediaType;
750                        return this;
751                }
752
753                /**
754                 * Sets the media type for the resource.
755                 * @param media the media type to set from {@link KeyValuesMedia#getMediaType()}.
756                 * @return this builder instance
757                 * @see KeyValuesMedia
758                 */
759                public Builder mediaType(KeyValuesMedia media) {
760                        return this.mediaType(media.getMediaType());
761                }
762
763                /**
764                 * Sets or clears the {@value KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_INTERPOLATE} flag.
765                 * @param flag whether to set or clear the flag
766                 * @return this builder instance
767                 * @see KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_INTERPOLATE
768                 */
769                public Builder noInterpolation(boolean flag) {
770                        LoadFlag.NO_INTERPOLATE.set(flags, flag);
771                        return this;
772                }
773
774                /**
775                 * Sets or clears the {@value KeyValuesResource#FLAG_NO_ADD} flag.
776                 * @param flag whether to set or clear the flag
777                 * @return this builder instance
778                 */
779                public Builder noAdd(boolean flag) {
780                        LoadFlag.NO_ADD.set(flags, flag);
781                        return this;
782                }
783
784                /**
785                 * Marks the resource as sensitive, meaning its values should not be printed.
786                 * @param flag whether to mark the resource as sensitive
787                 * @return this builder instance
788                 * @see KeyValuesResource#FLAG_SENSITIVE
789                 */
790                public Builder sensitive(boolean flag) {
791                        LoadFlag.SENSITIVE.set(flags, flag);
792                        return this;
793                }
794
795                /**
796                 * Marks the resource as not required.
797                 * @param flag true make the resource not required.
798                 * @return this
799                 */
800                public Builder noRequire(boolean flag) {
801                        LoadFlag.NO_REQUIRE.set(flags, flag);
802                        return this;
803                }
804
805                /**
806                 * Marks the resource as not required.
807                 * @param flag true make the resource not required.
808                 * @return this
809                 * @see KeyValuesResource#FLAG_OPTIONAL
810                 */
811                public Builder optional(boolean flag) {
812                        LoadFlag.NO_REQUIRE.set(flags, flag);
813                        return this;
814                }
815
816                Builder _flags(Set<LoadFlag> flags) {
817                        this.flags.clear();
818                        this.flags.addAll(flags);
819                        return this;
820                }
821
822                Builder _addFlag(LoadFlag flag) {
823                        flags.add(flag);
824                        return this;
825                }
826
827                Builder _addFilter(Filter filter) {
828                        filters.add(filter);
829                        return this;
830                }
831
832                /**
833                 * Parses a comma-separated string of resource flags and adds or removes the flags
834                 * from this builder.
835                 *
836                 * <p>
837                 * See the constants on this class for the available flag names. Flags are
838                 * case-insensitive and can be negated or reversed by prefixing them with
839                 * <code>"NO_"</code> or <code>"NOT_"</code>, or by removing these prefixes if
840                 * they are already present. If a flag is specified multiple times in the input
841                 * string, the last occurrence takes precedence.
842                 * </p>
843                 * <p>
844                 * The following demonstrates how to add and reverse resource flags using this
845                 * method:
846                 * </p>
847                 * {@snippet :
848                 * var builder = KeyValuesResource.builder(URI.create("classpath:/config.properties"));
849                 * builder.addFlags("no_require,no_interpolate,sensitive");
850                 *
851                 * // The flags "NO_REQUIRE", "NO_INTERPOLATE", and "SENSITIVE" are added to the builder.
852                 * }
853                 * @param csv a comma-separated, case-insensitive string of flag names
854                 * @return this builder instance for chaining
855                 */
856                public Builder addFlags(String csv) {
857                        LoadFlag.parseCSV(this.flags, csv);
858                        return this;
859                }
860
861                /**
862                 * Builds and returns a {@code KeyValuesResource} based on the current builder
863                 * state.
864                 * @return a new {@code KeyValuesResource} instance
865                 */
866                public KeyValuesResource build() {
867                        return DefaultKeyValuesResource.of(this, false);
868                }
869
870                InternalKeyValuesResource buildNormalized() {
871                        return DefaultKeyValuesResource.of(this, true);
872                }
873
874                // For unit test
875                InternalKeyValuesResource build(KeyValuesResourceParser parser) throws KeyValuesResourceParserException {
876                        return parser.normalizeResource(this.build());
877                }
878
879                @Override
880                public String toString() {
881                        return "KeyValuesResource.Builder[uri=" + uri + ", name=" + name + ", parameters=" + parameters + ", flags="
882                                        + flags + ", reference=" + reference + ", mediaType=" + mediaType + "]";
883                }
884
885        }
886
887}
888
889sealed interface InternalKeyValuesResource extends KeyValuesResource {
890
891        Set<LoadFlag> loadFlags();
892
893        boolean isRedacted();
894
895        public List<Filter> filters();
896
897        boolean normalized();
898
899}
900
901record DefaultKeyValuesResource(URI uri, //
902                String name, //
903                Set<LoadFlag> loadFlags, //
904                @Nullable KeyValue reference, //
905                @Nullable String mediaType, //
906                Parameters parameters, List<Filter> filters, boolean normalized) implements InternalKeyValuesResource {
907
908        DefaultKeyValuesResource {
909                validateResourceName(name);
910                loadFlags = FlagSet.copyOf(loadFlags, LoadFlag.class);
911                filters = List.copyOf(filters);
912        }
913
914        public static String validateResourceName(String identifier) {
915                return KeyValuesSource.validateName(identifier);
916        }
917
918        @Override
919        public Builder toBuilder() {
920                var resource = this;
921                var uri = resource.uri();
922                var name = resource.name();
923                var parameters = new LinkedHashMap<String, String>();
924                resource.parameters().forKeyValues(parameters::put);
925                var flags = FlagSet.enumSetOf(LoadFlag.class, resource.loadFlags());
926                var ref = resource.reference();
927                var mediaType = resource.mediaType();
928                var filters = resource.filters();
929                var b = new KeyValuesResource.Builder(uri, name, parameters, flags, ref, mediaType, filters);
930                return b;
931        }
932
933        static InternalKeyValuesResource of(KeyValuesResource.Builder builder, boolean normalized) {
934                Map<String, String> parameters = new LinkedHashMap<>(builder.parameters);
935                URI uri = builder.uri;
936                String name = builder.name;
937                var reference = builder.reference;
938                var loadFlags = builder.flags;
939                var mediaType = builder.mediaType;
940                Parameters variables = Parameters.of(parameters);
941                var filters = builder.filters;
942                return new DefaultKeyValuesResource(uri, name, loadFlags, reference, mediaType, variables, filters, normalized);
943        }
944
945        @Override
946        public boolean isRedacted() {
947                // TODO hmm if the resource has sensitive info should its URI be redacated as
948                // well?
949                // if (LoadFlag.SENSITIVE.isSet(loadFlags())) {
950                // return true;
951                // }
952                var ref = this.reference();
953                if (ref == null) {
954                        return false;
955                }
956                return ref.isSensitive();
957        }
958
959}
